content:
@all - in these "times", how come the WebRTC #BigBlueButton module - https://www.drupal.org/project/bbb has not already been #ported to BD? (BBB is getting quite important for both Moodle, NextCloud and Wordpress projects that focus on open source solutions.)

I just quick-tested with the update of the info file:

  • no errors, installs fine, no log messages
  • on creating the content type to use with it in BD, all fields appear, BUT nothing in the BigBlueButton vertical tab above the Submit button actually gets saved in the DB. BD saves the node without any errors, but on reload, all those BBB related fields are empty.

Backdrop should be in that "club", for sure. And "right now" is the moment, if there ever was such a thing as a "moment" for WebRTC / online screen sharing / online collaboration, etc., etc....

Is it possible that this is just a very small missing piece to get to work?

Hi, LeeteqXV. Welcome to the Backdrop CMS community on Zulip. I'm your friendly neighborhood Dragonbot. Try '@Dragonbot help' for a list of things I can help you with. There are lots of friendly humans that hang around here, so please feel free to ask questions.

Here is a short (3 min) video to help you navigate Zulip. https://youtu.be/DN8YL2MrsSU
@Dragonbot help

!<factoid> - play back a factoid
<thing>++ - give thing some karma
[item]++ or [user]++ | Adds karma
dragonbot adapter - Reply with the adapter
dragonbot add issue [IssuePath] - Add an issue to our 'needs attention' list
dragonbot add issue [IssuePath] - Add an issue to our 'needs attention' list
dragonbot alias <factoid> = <factoid>
dragonbot attention - How to add an issue to 'needs attention' list
dragonbot attention - How to add an issue to 'needs attention' list
dragonbot delete reminder <action> - Delete reminder matching <action> (exact match required)
dragonbot drop <factoid> - permanently forget a factoid
dragonbot echo <text> - Reply back with <text>
dragonbot factoids - get a link to the raw factoid data
dragonbot forget <factoid> - forget a factoid
dragonbot help - Displays all of the help commands that this bot knows about.
dragonbot help <query> - Displays all help commands that match <query>.
dragonbot karma <thing> - check thing's karma (if <thing> is omitted, show the top 5)
dragonbot karma best [n] - show the top n (default: 5)
dragonbot karma best [n] - top [n]
dragonbot karma empty <thing> - empty a thing's karma
dragonbot karma worst [n] - bottom [n]
dragonbot karma worst [n] - show the bottom n (default: 5)
dragonbot learn <factoid> = <details> - learn a new factoid
dragonbot learn <factoid> =~ s/expression/replace/gi - edit a factoid
dragonbot list all factoids - list all factoids
dragonbot map me <query> - Returns a map view of the area returned by query.
dragonbot ping - Reply with pong
dragonbot pug bomb N - get N pugs
dragonbot pug me - Receive a pug
dragonbot remember <factoid> - remember a factoid
dragonbot remind me (on <date>|in <time>) to/that <action> - Set a reminder in <time> to do an <action> <time> is in the format 1 day, 2 hours, 5 minutes etc. Time segments are optional, as are commas
dragonbot remind show - Shows a list of current reminders ('show reminders' will also work)
dragonbot remove issue - Remove your 'needs attetion' issue
dragonbot remove issue - Remove your 'needs attetion' issue
dragonbot schedule [add|new] "<cron pattern>(,<utc offset>)" <message> - Schedule a message that runs recurrently.
dragonbot schedule [add|new] "<datetime pattern>" <message> - Schedule a message that runs on a specific date and time
dragonbot schedule [add|new] #<room> "<cron pattern>(,<utc offset>)" <message> - Schedule a message to a specific room that runs recurrently
dragonbot schedule [add|new] #<room> "<datetime pattern>" <message> - Schedule a message to a specific room that runs on a specific date and time
dragonbot schedule [cancel|del|delete|remove] <id> - Cancel the schedule
dragonbot schedule [upd|update] <id> <message> - Update scheduled message
dragonbot schedule env - Show hubot schedule environments
dragonbot schedule list #<room> - List all scheduled messages for specified room
dragonbot schedule list - List all scheduled messages for current room
dragonbot schedule list all - List all scheduled messages for any rooms
dragonbot search <substring> - list factoids which match (by factoid key or result)
dragonbot show needs attention - Show a list of issues that need your attention
dragonbot show needs attention - Show a list of issues that need your attention
dragonbot the rules - Make sure hubot still knows the rules.
dragonbot time - Reply with current time
dragonbot translate me <phrase> - Searches for a translation for the <phrase> and then prints that bad boy out.
dragonbot translate me from <source> into <target> <phrase> - Translates <phrase> from <source> into <target>. Both <source> and <target> are optional
dragonbot welcome - Shows welcome message
dragonbot welcome - Shows welcome message
hi @LeeteqXV and welcome to Zulip. It sounds like BBB is pretty close and wouldn't need much work.

@LeeteqXV I've not used BBB but an experimenting with a new module to integrate Jitsi: https://github.com/backdrop-contrib/jitsi

backdrop-contrib/jitsi
Easily add Jitsi Meet video conferences to Backdrop CMS. - backdrop-contrib/jitsi
If you try it out let me know what you think
@LeeteqXV I'm not arguing, but https://www.drupal.org/project/bbb shows only 225 sites using that module.
@LeeteqXV I want to port the BBB module this summer. I know BBB, but I haven't got BBB test server with Greenlight.
@Attila Vasas ++
vasas** 1000% (Karma: 1)

I have got a BBB test server :slight_smile: : docker pull bigbluebutton/bigbluebutton
docker run --rm -p 80:80/tcp -p 1935:1935 -p 3478:3478 -p 3478:3478/udp bigbluebutton/bigbluebutton -h 192.168.1.7

:fireworks: A new ported module is published: Big Blue Button module https://backdropcms.org/project/bbb :fireworks:
@LeeteqXV
@Attila Vasas ++
vasas** go team. (Karma: 2)
@Attila Vasas ++
vasas** 1000% (Karma: 3)

@Attila Vasas , I have implemented your new module and it works right out of the box. Excellent and thanx a bunch. I will add some more info related to this and my take on the perspectives for Backdrop here shortly/within this week.
@LeeteqXV I am very happy, thank You! :grinning: Note: I will be on vacation from July 13-25.
@Attila Vasas It would be worth trying to figure out how to get the new BBB module listed here: https://bigbluebutton.org/integrations/

@Laryn Good idea, thanks!: https://github.com/bigbluebutton/bigbluebutton.github.io/issues/180

New integration - Backdrop CMS · Issue #180 · bigbluebutton/bigbluebutton.github.io
BigBlueButton has got a new integration with Backdrop CMS: https://backdropcms.org/project/bbb Please add it to the list of integrations: https://bigbluebutton.org/integrations/ Thanks!
@Attila Vasas ++
vasas** :-) (Karma: 4)

@klonos or somebody. Please help in a license problem: https://github.com/bigbluebutton/bigbluebutton.github.io/issues/180
The ported 7.x-1.x branch of BBB Drupal module hasn't got License.txt file.

New integration - Backdrop CMS · Issue #180 · bigbluebutton/bigbluebutton.github.io
BigBlueButton has got a new integration with Backdrop CMS: https://backdropcms.org/project/bbb Please add it to the list of integrations: https://bigbluebutton.org/integrations/ Thanks!

@Attila Vasas https://github.com/bigbluebutton/bigbluebutton.github.io/issues/180#issuecomment-664593137

New integration - Backdrop CMS · Issue #180 · bigbluebutton/bigbluebutton.github.io
BigBlueButton has got a new integration with Backdrop CMS: https://backdropcms.org/project/bbb Please add it to the list of integrations: https://bigbluebutton.org/integrations/ Thanks! Suggested e...
Thank You @Laryn ++
laryn kudos (Karma: 10)
